About us PCM COLLECTIVE LTD PCM COLLECTIVE LTD PCM COLLECTIVE LTD PCM COLLECTIVE LTD Home About us Primrose Collective Current Events 2025 PCM_Collective Apply - 2025 Markets Apple Day Market 2025 Magic of Christmas 2025 Primrose Collective 2025 Sponsors More Home About us Primrose Collective Current Events 2025 PCM_Collective Apply - 2025 Markets Apple Day Market 2025 Magic of Christmas 2025 Primrose Collective 2025 Sponsors PCM COLLECTIVE LTD PCM COLLECTIVE LTD PCM COLLECTIVE LTD PCM COLLECTIVE LTD Home About us Primrose Collective Current Events 2025 PCM_Collective Apply - 2025 Markets Apple Day Market 2025 Magic of Christmas 2025 Primrose Collective 2025 Sponsors About Us Meet Christie My name is Christie Schick, I am the owner/operator of PCM Collective Ltd & Primrose Collective out of the Comox Valley, British Columbia. I started my business by putting together a small Christmas craft fair in 2015 after returning from Maternity Leave with my second child in Victoria. I created this first fair in the hopes of supporting my local, small business community. From there it grew to Summer Markets, Children's Fairs and multiple Christmas Fairs. Getting to know so many small businesses located on beautiful Vancouver Island has been an amazing experience Fairs & Markets I am proud to present the fairs and markets I have the pleasure of organizing past and present. Woodgrove Artisan Market - 2021 Held at Woodgrove Shopping Centre in Nanaimo. ¬†This large artisan market is held outdoors in their main parking lot. This summer market holds over 70 local Artisans. Spring - Wind & Willow Children's Fair * Handmade children vendors and local Island businesses specializing in all things Baby, Children & Maternity. Summer - Market in the Square & Eats & Beats Festival. * Market in the Square is held in the historic Market Square in the heart of Downtown Victoria. June, July, August. One Friday a month. *Eats & Beats Festival held in Colwood Bc. I have the pleasure of organizing the markets aspect of this fabulous community event that draws in over 5000 people each year. Held in July (date for 2019 to be determined) Fall/Winter - Winter Fair ¬†Stop & Shop, Magic of Christmas craft fair ¬†& *NEW this year, Hillside Holiday Artisans Market. * Winter Fair is held the second weekend in November. It is a handmade only market that is held in one of Victoria's local malls and runs through the halls. Winter Fair has been a wonderful addition to Tillicum Shopping Centre and has been extremely successful for vendors as well as to other customers. Looking forward to year 3! * Magic of Christmas craft fair is my largest fair. With over 120 vendors in attendance. It is held at Eagle Ridge Arena in Langford BC over 3 days, the third weekend in November. The fair has been consistently growing for the past 4 years and we are excited to see what comes for year 5! By far the most popular fair in the Westshore, this event draws thousands from all over the island. *Hillside Holiday Artisans Market - The new kid in the block. This is our first annual Christmas market, held in the halls of Hillside Shopping Centre. We will be accommodating up to 100 vendors..winding their way through the halls do the shopping centre. November 30th/ December 1st. Copyright ¬© 2025 Pacific Coast Market Collective - All Rights Reserved. Powered by

WHERE CAN WE BUY TICKETS TO ATTEND? Tickets can be purchased on howler (available soon) , or at the door Is the Park and Ride available? Yes, visitors can park at Mall of Africa and take advantage of the complimentary shuttle service to and from the event venue. Simply use the promo code FOM25 on the Admyt app for free parking at Mall of Africa. Pickup and drop-off points will be at entrances 6 and 8. What are the ticket prices? 1 Day general access pass ‚Äì R295.00 (online) 1 Day general access pass ‚Äì R320.00 (at the door) 1 Day general access pass (Pensioners) ‚Äì R260.00 Weekend Pass ‚Äì R735.00 Children (4-12) ‚Äì R82.00 Children (0-3) ‚Äì FREE VIP and Experience tickets are coming soon. Is there parking available? Yes, there is limited parking available at the venue. Additionally, visitors can take advantage of the Park and Ride service from Mall of Africa for added convenience. What are the opening and closing times? Gates open Friday ‚Äì Sunday 08:30 ‚Äì 18:30 Can I get a free drive around Kyalami? Yes, you can enjoy complimentary drives around the iconic Kyalami Grand Prix Circuit through our OEM Partners. Just head to the main or upper pit areas on the day and book a session with an OEM. One of their experienced drivers will take you around the track for an unforgettable experience. Alternatively you can purchase an Experience to go around Kyalami in a selection of vehicles, experience tickets will go live in May. Is the 4 x 4 track operational? Absolutely! The 4√ó4 track is fully operational. Hop into the passenger seat of the latest 4x4s as experienced instructors guide you through the course. Prepare to conquer challenging terrains and test the capabilities of rugged vehicles. What is the self-drive option? The self-drive option offers visitors the chance to test drive new vehicles on the handling track within a controlled environment. It‚Äôs an exclusive opportunity to experience the thrill of test driving your next car firsthand! Please ensure you have a valid driver‚Äôs license, and kindly note that a breathalyzer test will be conducted. Are there VIP track drives and experiences available? Yes, we offer VIP track drives and exclusive experiences for those looking to elevate their Festival of Motoring adventure. Thursday, September 11, 2025 Sign in / Join About Foodie Faves Interviews Food Travels Recipes Contact Facebook Instagram Twitter Vimeo Youtube Tasty Chomps A Local's Culinary Guide Home About About Us Media/Press Newsletter Archives Holiday Dining Food Guides Favorite Restaurants Videos Recipes Interviews Brunch Best Bets Happy Hour Travels Hotels Florida St Augustine South Florida Miami Tampa St.Petersburg Sarasota London Hong Kong Vietnam New York City Atlanta Contact Specials More Search Saigon Night Market ‚Äì Endless Summer Festival ‚Äì Debuts in Orlando ‚Äì June 8-9th, 2024 By Ricky Ly May 31, 2024 In Orlando Share Facebook Twitter Pinterest WhatsApp Linkedin ReddIt Print 22623 Saigon Night Market ‚Äì Endless Summer Festival 2911 E Robinson St, Orlando, FL 32803 June 8th & 9th 2024 3pm-10pm The popular Saigon Night Market from Tampa is taking the show on the road and visiting Orlando this June 8th at Festival Park in Orlando. The event will feature: 80+ Multicultural Food Vendors & Trucks Various Music Artists Dance Performances Live DJ & Band Food Competition and Contests Kids Activities including Waterslide and Inflatables Raffles for chance to win BIG prizes We spoke with the organizers about the event! What is the Saigon Night Market like for those who have never been before? The Saigon Night Market can be described in three words. Culture, Community, and Diversity. Through music, multicultural food, and entertainment, we highlight various Asian cultures, and provide a space in which anybody of any culture can enjoy. How much does everything cost for attendees? The festivals are very affordable. Entry is $10 per day, or $15 for both Saturday/Sunday. We provide convenient parking spaces at $20 per car if you are unable to find nearby parking. And vendors price their food very fair! For the experience we deliver, including Live Band, Lion Dance, Dance Performers, and Musical Acts, you can bet that it‚Äôll be an experience worthwhile. What kind of food will be available? What is unique? The food options are endless. To name a few, we have Vietnamese, Thai, Lao, Korean, Filipino, and even Latino food vendors. You can spend the whole day and not eat the same food twice! A few unique bites that people may not have had the opportunity to taste would be grilled chicken feet, Balut, Lao sausage, and the savory Filipino desserts. Tell us about the organizers? The organizers consist of two Vietnamese friends. One being an entrepreneur, and the other being a music artist. We came together to do a fun project for the community without thinking much of it, but it eventually grew and became known as the Saigon Night Market. Along the way, we‚Äôve met many people that we‚Äôve been blessed to be able to share this journey with as one big family. What type of vendors are you looking for? The more diverse the better. Anybody and everybody is welcome to vend. At times, when we see we have too many vendors of a specific culture, we tend to focus on picking up different types of vendors to make sure everyone gets a chance to showcase their foods. How can vendors / sponsors sign up? Vendors and sponsors can reach out via email ( saigonnightmarketfl@gmail.com ). How to buy a ticket? Tickets are sold at the gate, or available on Eventbrite for pre-purchase. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/endless-summer-music-food-festival-tickets-907987895237 Share Facebook Twitter Pinterest WhatsApp Linkedin ReddIt Print Must Read Pumpkin Season at Metro Diner Returns with Pumpkin Pancakes, Waffles, and Bread Pudding Ricky Ly - UPCOMING EVENT: Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Food & Wine Classic returns November 14-15 Ricky Ly - H Mart Orlando Announces Opening Date ‚Äì September 25, 2025 Ricky Ly - New Omakase at illume Rooftop Bar & Lounge ‚Äì JW Marriott Bonnet Creek Tiffany Nguyen - Inside Look: Tempo + Grace at Aloft Lake Nona Hotel Ricky Ly - Previous article NEW Next Generation ABC Fine Wine & Spirits with Whiskey Tastings opens in Winter Garden, Florida Next article Upcoming Event: World of Whiskey Event at Orlando World Center Marriott on June 15, 2024 Related Articles Pumpkin Season at Metro Diner Returns with Pumpkin Pancakes, Waffles, and Bread Pudding UPCOMING EVENT: Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Food & Wine Classic returns November 14-15 H Mart Orlando Announces Opening Date ‚Äì September 25, 2025 New Omakase at illume Rooftop Bar & Lounge ‚Äì JW Marriott Bonnet Creek LEAVE A REPLY Cancel reply Log in to leave a comment Downtown Magazine PRO Facebook Instagram Twitter Youtube About Foodie Faves Interviews Food Travels Recipes Contact TastyChomps.com A Local's Culinary Guide About Foodie Faves Interviews Food Travels Recipes Contact Latest Pumpkin Season at Metro Diner Returns with Pumpkin Pancakes, Waffles, and Bread Pudding Orlando Sep 7, 2025 0 Established in 1992 as a family-owned eatery in¬†Jacksonville, Florida,... Event Operations Manager National Cherry Blossom Festival, Inc. , a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization based in Washington, DC, is currently seeking an Event Operations Manager. Company Description The National Cherry Blossom Festival produces and promotes the nation‚Äôs greatest springtime celebration and is dedicated to promoting the beauty of nature and international friendship through year-round programs, events, and educational and entertainment initiatives that enhance our environment, showcase arts and culture, and build community spirit. The Event Operations Manager is responsible for managing the production and logistical plans and timelines for all National Cherry Blossom Festival events. The Event Operations Manager manages vendors, supplies, and equipment for all events, and oversees load-in, load-out, and all on-site logistics. Reporting to the Director of Programming, the Event Operations Manager will collaborate with all teams to develop and implement production plans and curate programmatic elements of each event. They will also plan and implement all health, safety, transportation and traffic management plans. Responsibilities Provide primary support for the programming and operations functions of the National Cherry Blossom Festival. Communicate with management staff, board members, clients and vendors using a high degree of tact, professionalism and discretion. Carry out directives and established policies and complete assignments with moderate supervision. Organize daily work within parameters set by the National Cherry Blossom Festival. This position reports to the Director of Programming and works in conjunction with the Vice President. The Event Operations Manager is responsible for: Event Production Develop and execute all production and logistical plans and timelines including programmatic elements, food and beverage, sponsorship activations, benefit fulfillment and event logistics. Manage vendors, supplies, and equipment including site/venue management, contingency planning, parking, health and safety, signage and collateral, sound, lighting and staging, staffing, traffic and waste management. Maintain inventory of equipment and supplies in storage Manage site plans and asset management documents Assist Festival staff in liaising with venue representatives and the local community Keep the Festival apprised of all financial, production and logistical issues Event Management Work with event managers to curate the programmatic elements of events Be the liaison between the programming and business operations teams to process necessary paperwork including agreements, contracts, purchase orders, expense vouchers and COIs. Event Operations Implement Health & Safety and Transportation & Traffic Management plans at events via coordination with vendors Acquire documentation and approvals for all required permits and applications via District of Columbia agencies and the National Park Service Make copies and hang permits and proper signage (parking, directional, health & safety) Communicate and work collaboratively across departments with responsibilities including, but not limited to: Submitting and reviewing assets (Marketing) Ensuring fulfillment of sponsorship deliverables (Sponsorship) Submitting invoices (Business Operations) Identify event volunteer needs (Volunteer Management) On-Site Logistics and Management Oversee load-in and load out of each event, managing vendors, equipment and supplies Oversee the Operations crew to ensure production plans are implemented accurately. Establish and manage Event Operations Center in cooperation with Festival staff and volunteers Monitor and resolve any production and logistical issues that may arise Manage inventory pre- and post- for all festival events Manage the collection and distribution of event materials and supplies Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs degree or other equivalent experience Minimum of three years of demonstrated experience working in event management and operations Strong experience in permit acquisition within the District of Columbia Excellent project coordination, time management, and organizational skills with the ability to juggle and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced environment Strong creative, strategic and analytical skills Strong leadership skills Superior communication and writing skills Attention to detail, high productivity and concern for accuracy and excellence Proficiency in Microsoft Office; experience with Monday.com or Slack is a plus Must be a self-starter, proactive and driven with a strong work ethic, a high level of motivation, a strong sense of urgency when needed, with the ability to work without direct supervision and consistently meet deadlines Commitment to working with shared leadership and in cross-functional teams Ability to work non-traditional hours Ability to foster positive, productive relationships, collaboration and teamwork, internally and externally, among staff, board members, volunteers, partners and other Festival stakeholders As an integral part of the National Cherry Blossom Festival team, this salaried exempt position participates fully in the production and execution of all Festival events. This requires flexibility to be available evenings and weekends and to work additional hours during peak periods. TARGET START DATE: August 25 ‚Äì September 3, 2025 COMPENSATION/BENEFITS Salary range: $60,000 ‚Äì $65,000/year. Benefits package includes health insurance with prescription drug, dental, and eye plans (substantially underwritten by NCBF); annual and sick leave; short-term and long-term disability; life insurance; flexible spending account; 401K plan with safe harbor contributions eligible 6 months after hire; parking/transit subsidy. The National Cherry Blossom Festival is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The Montpelier Fall Festival is a free, city-wide event on the beautiful Vermont State House lawn, celebrating community spirit and commitment to the Montpelier Roxbury Public Schools. 2024 included the Onion River Outdoor 1-mile Fun Run, live music and performances, games on the lawn including the Celebrity Dunk Tank, local crafts, local food and more! This annual event has become a favorite activity for students, staff and families in Montpelier and Roxbury. Each year, attendance grows ‚Äì we expect approximately 1,500 participants from around central Vermont. Since its inception in 2016, the MFF has raised over $70,000 for the Montpelier Roxbury Public School Partners in Education ( MRPS PIE ), which supports our local public schools' many initiatives and is fueled by family and community volunteers. Thank you to our fantastic volunteers, loyal sponsors and generous community! About MRPS PIE MRPS Partners in Education Corporation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit charitable organization founded in January 2019. Our mission is to serve the communities of Montpelier Roxbury Public Schools, Vermont. We provide opportunities for enrichment, build community, and serve as a vehicle for information and advocacy for parents and the community. MRPS PIE helps to organize, support, and increase fundraising potential for each of our schools‚Äô parent and caregiver groups. About Onion River Outdoors Onion River Outdoors is a locally owned, community-minded outdoor gear and apparel shop in Montpelier. They are outdoor recreation experts and an eclectic and fun group of active, outdoor- loving folks seeking healthier, happier, and more eco-friendly ways to live. They believe that when consumers support local business and local business supports the community, we all win.
